etymologies: modern Latin, from Greek drakaina, feminine of drakōn ‘serpent, dragon’ (the genus Dracaena includes Dracaena draco, the dragon tree)

definitions: a tropical palmlike shrub or tree with ornamental foliage, popular as a greenhouse or indoor plant.

notes.text: Genera Dracaena and Cordyline, family Agavaceae. See also dragon tree

shortDefinitions: tropical palmlike shrub or tree with ornamental foliage
